events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of January 9th, involving another vehicle at an intersection.
Claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after review of initial report and customer description of the collision.
A claims agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle this case and contact the claimant for further details.
The claimant was contacted and the claim was formally acknowledged, providing reassurance and next steps.
Requested police report, photos of vehicle damage, and insurance information from the customer to proceed with claim validation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the police report and clear images showing the extent of collision damage.
Investigation began with a review of all submitted evidence, contacting involved parties and verifying the claim details.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damages are covered under the current policy terms.
A settlement offer was drafted and proposed to the claimant based on repair estimates and policy limits.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and responsiveness of the claims team.
Formal approval of the claim was granted based on investigation findings and acceptance of the settlement terms.
The agreed settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimant's designated account promptly.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that the claimant received payment and all procedures were complete.
